subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Angel Syndicates: Pooling Small Bets
description: One-minute skill: Angel Syndicates: Pooling Small Bets.

hook.text: One angel has $25K. Alone, that's too small. In a syndicate, 40 angels pool $1M together.

buildup.text: Platforms like AngelList let a lead investor organize dozens of smaller investors into one deal.

discovery.text: Syndicates democratized angel investing. You no longer need millions to back startups.

twist.text: The lead takes a carryâ€”usually 20% of profits. Their reputation is on the line every time.

climax.text: Naval Ravikant's syndicate backed companies worth billions using small individual checks.

punchline.text: Alone you write small checks. Together you fund unicorns.

quiz.question: How do angel syndicates work?
options: Multiple small investors pool money behind a lead investor for one deal
Angels compete to invest the most in each startup
Syndicates are government programs matching angels with startups
